title: [K-12] Surgical Training Simulation Enhanced Education (SEE) Program for Neurosurgery: Integrating Scientific Inquiry and Clinical Skills – Experimental Design and Evidence-Based Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic neurosurgical anatomy and experience with surgical tool usage, understanding of scientific inquiry methods (observation, hypothesis formulation, variable control, experimental design), and foundational medical data analysis skills
context.additional_context: High-fidelity VR surgical simulation training for medical device company specialists. Participants evaluate surgical procedures based on experimental design principles, derive evidence-based conclusions, and systematically strengthen clinical skills through scientific inquiry processes.

learning_goals: Participants perform basic incision and suturing techniques in neurosurgery simulations with 90% accuracy, analyze tissue response variables through scientific observation, and derive conclusions based on experimental data.

Participants achieve a ≥70% success rate in complex clinical scenarios (e.g., hemorrhage management), apply hypothesis-driven emergency care strategies, and explore optimal treatment plans through variable control.

Participants write reports demonstrating clinical judgment and decision-making skills in project-based assessments after simulation training, systematically analyze experimental data, and present conclusions supported by scientific evidence.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
